intro: Microcharis tritoides subsp. obbiadensis, commonly known as the Obbiadens ghostflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and its unique, translucent, ghost-like flowers that appear in late spring. The plant thrives in high-altitude, humid environments with partial shade and well-drained soil. Its flowers emit a faint, sweet scent that attracts specific pollinators, such as certain species of moths. Due to its restricted habitat and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
